title: Pasta With Tomato Sauce And Arugula
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pasta With Tomato Sauce And Arugulan a try. This recipe serves 3. One portion of this dish contains around 30g of protein, 24g of fat, and a total of 753 calories. For $1.83 per serving, this recipe covers 32% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up salt and pepper, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 82%. This score is super. Try Sausage, Tomato & Arugula Pasta, Smoky Tomato, Roasted Red Pepper & Arugula Pasta, and Balsamic-Tossed Pasta With Fresh Tomato, Arugula and Mozzarella for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
